params.text: Consider the encoder of an already trained English-to-Spanish neural machine translation system being fed with the sentence "Harry Potter rolled over inside his blankets without waking up". In a square similar to the one in figure 4 of chapter 7, draw your guess of a possible non-contextual 2-dimensional representation of the words in the sentence; alternatively, you may write down the coordinates for each word. After that, give a possible attention vector that could be used to refine the representation of the word "waking" in the first layer of the encoder by combining some of the non-contextual representations. Justify all your decisions. Consider which words should be close without considering a particular context first, and then take into account a different set of proximity rules in the context of this particular sentence.
